definition: to sit down/to take a seat
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
seat/base/stand/CL:個|个[ge4]/classifier for buildings, mountains and similar immovable objects

sentences.english: The whole audience rose as the Chancellor and the Ambassador walked onto the rostrum and took their seats.
sentences.chinese: 全体听众起立，彭定康校长和刘大使走上主席台落座。

sentences.english: Everyonetakes his or her seat and settles in for a lovely afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 在美丽的午后，善男信女落座于各自的位置。

sentences.english: Hearty chuckles from the early morning crowd just settling into their seats.
sentences.chinese: 一早进入会场落座的人群里传来会心的笑声。

sentences.english: As I took my seat I was greeted by a dazzling array of silverware at my place setting.
sentences.chinese: 刚一落座，我就被面前摆放的银器弄得眼花缭乱。

sentences.english: All instrument jade asked ren ying ying after everyone is poison in the body how to work out.
sentences.chinese: 众人落座后仪玉问任盈盈体内的毒是如何解掉的。

sentences.english: It is impolite to begin a meal until everyone is seated.
sentences.chinese: 在他人落座之前就开始就餐是很不礼貌的。

sentences.english: Backseating the valve stops any flame from traveling through the valve and connecting hose into the crankcase.
sentences.chinese: 落座的阀门阻止火焰通过阀门和连接管进入曲轴箱。

sentences.english: After the boarding process, I settled into my seat in the Business Class cabin, which was full.
sentences.chinese: 登机以后，我在公务舱落座，舱内已经满员了。

definition: to seat (sb in a restaurant etc)/to take one's seat
to be seated
to sit down
to sit down
to take one's seat
guest and host
to sit properly/to sit up straight
to exchange conventional greetings/to exchange pleasantries
to exchange conventional greetings/to talk about the weather
to retire/to withdraw/to retreat/to step down
to salute/to make one's salutations
polite greeting/civilities/to exchange pleasantries
to return a politeness/to present a gift in return
to toast/to propose a toast
to be all present
to call out to/to greet/to say hello to/to inform/to take care of/to take care that one does not
